articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: China coronavirus outbreak: All the latest updates
articles.description: China reports 69 people died on Thursday with additional 2,447 new coronavirus infections in Hubei province alone.
articles.content:
The death toll from the coronavirus outbreak in mainland China rose to 618 on Thursday, Chinese state television reported on Friday.
There had been a further 2,447 cases detected in Hubei, the epicentre of the outbreak, pushing the number of infections up to… [+2353 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Coronavirus outbreak: Hospitals in China swamped with patients
articles.description: Hospitals are swamped with patients, leading to an acute shortage of beds while there is a lack of face masks in the markets.
articles.content:
Hospitals are still struggling to cope with the number of people infected.
And a growing number of countries are closing their borders to Chinese travellers.
Al Jazeera's Adrian Brown reports from Hong Kong, which says it will quarantine all new arrivals fr… [+15 chars]

articles.author: Ruairi Casey
articles.title: Researchers ramp up efforts to develop coronavirus vaccine
articles.description: Pharmaceutical firms and research groups in China, US and other countries are racing to find a vaccine for new virus.
articles.content:
In medical research labs around the world, scientists are racing to develop a vaccine for a new type of coronavirus that has infected more than 28,000 people and killed 500 others, most of them in China.
Weeks after the virus was first detected, at least a d… [+7374 chars]

articles.title: Confused about the coronavirus? | Start Here
articles.description: Start Here answers questions about what coronavirus is, how it infects people and how you can keep yourself safe.

articles.author: Sarah Clarke
articles.title: Coronavirus: Hong Kong intensifies checks on travellers
articles.description: From Saturday, all travellers crossing from the mainland to the city will be quarantined for 14 days.
articles.content:
A growing number of countries are closing their borders to travellers from China, as the death toll from coronavirus infection rises to 563.
Two cruise ships - one in Japan and the other in Hong Kong - are also in quarantine after passengers were found to be… [+73 chars]

articles.author: Aditya Bhattacharji
articles.title: The coronavirus: What should we be worried about?
articles.description: Outbreaks in poorer countries, economic downturn, and global panic are of real concern during this epidemic.
articles.content: Uncertainty about the ultimate toll of the coronavirus outbreak centred in China is the primary driver of the aggressive response and heightened media attention it is getting. In the coming weeks, emerging epidemiological and virological analyses will be crit… [+7158 chars]

articles.author: Erin Hale
articles.title: Politics of coronavirus: Taiwan, China and WHO
articles.description: Deadly outbreak lays bare challenges of political situation faced by democratic island that China claims as its own.
articles.content:
As Taiwan faces 13 coronavirus cases on Thursday, its exclusion from leading global organisations has come under scrutiny as countries around the world struggle to prevent the spread of the highly-infectious virus.

articles.author: Shawn Yuan
articles.title: 'I want to live': China's workers struggle amid virus shutdown
articles.description: Chinese in informal work are struggling to make ends meet as the coronavirus empties streets and shuts down businesses.
articles.content:
Beijing, China - On Tuesday morning, Lanying Guo began work at her small dumpling restaurant in a Beijing alleyway - just as she had for the previous seven days.

articles.description: China reports 73 people died on Wednesday, the highest since the outbreak began late last year.
